snippet: Charles Marville, the 19th-century photographer who documented old parts of Paris destined for demolition, turns out to be a man for our time.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook appreciates work of Charles Marville, illustrator and photographer hired by Paris officials to document structural changes taking place in city in 1860s, as tenements and shops gave way to luxury apartment buildings; Marville's photographs are on view at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
lead_paragraph: Charles Marville, the 19th-century photographer who documented old parts of Paris destined for demolition, turns out to be a man for our time.

headline.print_headline: Glimpsing a Lost Paris, Before Gentrification
headline.seo: Charles Marville’s Pictures Show What Was Destroyed
headline.main: Glimpsing a Lost Paris, Before Gentrification
